summary:
Headline:
Adobe projects solid fiscal year 2025 full-year revenue of $23.65-$23.70B, driven by continued growth in Digital Media and Digital Experience segments, with non-GAAP operating margins around 46%. EPS guidance is strong, with non-GAAP EPS expected between $20.80 and $20.85.

Growth & revenue drivers:
- Total revenue guidance for FY2025: $23.65B to $23.70B.
- Digital Media segment revenue: $17.56B to $17.59B.
- Digital Media ending ARR growth: 11.3% YoY.
- Digital Experience segment revenue: $5.84B to $5.86B.
- Digital Experience subscription revenue: $5.39B to $5.41B.
- Growth supported by AI innovation and market opportunities, though specific Q4 revenue figures were not disclosed in the excerpt.

Margins / profitability:
- Non-GAAP operating margin expected around 45.5% for Q4 and ~46% for full fiscal year 2025.
- Non-GAAP tax rate assumed at ~18.5%.
- Diluted share count estimated at ~418 million for Q4 and ~427 million for full year.
- EPS guidance: GAAP $4.27-$4.32 for Q4; full year GAAP $16.53-$16.58.
- Non-GAAP EPS: Q4 $5.35-$5.40; full year $20.80-$20.85.

Guidance & outlook:
- Guidance assumes current macroeconomic conditions.
- No detailed Q4 revenue or segment breakdown provided beyond targets.
- Company emphasizes ongoing strategic investments in AI and innovation.
- No explicit commentary on near-term risks or changes to prior outlook.

Risks / watchpoints:
- Risks include macroeconomic fluctuations, AI development challenges, competitive pressures, regulatory and legal risks, currency fluctuations, and operational risks.
- Forward-looking statements subject to uncertainties; actual results may differ materially.
- Watch for updates in Adobe’s upcoming 10-Q filing for Q4 results and any revisions to guidance.
- Continued monitoring of AI integration success and macroeconomic impacts advised.

meta.company_hint: ADBE 2025Q4 Q3 FY2025 earnings press release
meta.speaker: CFO (preferred, with fallbacks)
